input:

14:11 Caption: Neil Taylor (Swansea) makes a slide tackle, but referee Neil Swarbrick blows for a foul. It's a free kick to Manchester Utd, but they probably won't attempt a direct shot on goal from here.

14:59 Event: Shots off target by Manchester
15:22 Event: Throw-in by Swansea
15:48 Caption: Marcos Rojo (Manchester United) connects with the free kick and produces a header goalwards which is well blocked. The goalkeeper doesn't have to worry about that one.
16:02 Event: Ball out of play
16:08 Event: Throw-in by Swansea
16:18 Event: Shots on target by Swansea
16:29 Caption: Wayne Routledge (Swansea) latches on to a pass on the edge of the box, but he can't get any power into the shot and fails to trouble David de Gea.
16:42 Event: Foul by Manchester
17:30 Event: Ball out of play

19:55 Caption: A nice lofted cross finds Wayne Rooney (Manchester United) unmarked and he displays an excellent touch to control the ball. Wayne Rooney (Manchester United) drills a low shot towards the middle of the net, but doesn't give the goalkeeper anything to worry about. An easy save.
20:16 Event: Ball out of play
20:42 Caption: Jonjo Shelvey (Swansea) races towards goal but the defender gets back well to make a challenge. Swansea get a corner.
20:52 Event: Corner by Swansea
21:04 Caption: A dangerous looking corner kick from Gylfi Sigurdsson (Swansea) is cleared to safety by the defence.
21:06 Event: Ball out of play
21:33 Event: Clearance by Manchester
22:34 Event: Foul by Manchester
22:46 Caption: Neil Swarbrick blows his whistle for a foul after Marouane Fellaini (Manchester United) hacks down one of his opponents.
25:42 Caption: Robin van Persie (Manchester United) sends a cross into the box, but Lukasz Fabianski comes off his line to gather the ball.
26:15 Event: Shots off target by Manchester
26:23 Caption: That's a well-taken pass by Robin van Persie (Manchester United). He unleashes a strike from the edge of the box, but blazes it high over the bar.
26:54 Event: Clearance by Swansea
27:03 Event: Ball out of play
27:14 Event: Throw-in by Manchester
27:23 Caption: Goal - 0:1! Ander Herrera (Manchester United) gets a shot away from the edge of the box and scores into the bottom left corner. Angel Di Maria provided an assist for the goal.
27:36 Event: Goal by Manchester
28:30 Caption: Swansea are dominating the game at the moment by exchanging a combination of one or two touch passes. Great harmony between the players.
28:33 Event: Kick-off by Swansea
29:09 Event: Ball out of play
29:26 Event: Throw-in by Swansea
29:31 Caption: It's in the back of the net! Jonjo Shelvey plays it into the box, and Sung-Yong Ki (Swansea) gets on the end of the cross to put it into the back of the net. 0:1.
29:32 Event: Goal by Swansea

37:44 Caption: Luke Shaw (Manchester United) was trying to get to the ball but clattered into the legs of the opponent as well. Neil Swarbrick blows his whistle for an infringement.
38:58 Event: Shots off target by Manchester
39:09 Caption: What a chance that is! Robin van Persie (Manchester United) finds himself unmarked in a promising position after receiving a cross on the edge of the box and his attempt sails a whisker wide of the left post.
39:32 Event: Clearance by Swansea

42:51 Event: Ball out of play

43:25 Caption: Wayne Rooney (Manchester United) takes the corner kick, but Lukasz Fabianski reads it well and stops the effort.
44:14 Event: Foul by Manchester
44:25 Event: Yellow card by Manchester
44:43 Caption: The foul by Marouane Fellaini (Manchester United) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Neil Swarbrick.
45:14 Event: Foul by Manchester
46:23 Caption: The first half of today's match has just finished.
46:59 Caption: There was certainly plenty of action during that opening 45 minutes. Both sides have struggled for dominance over the game. The home team are playing long-ball football unlike the away side, who are attempting to hold onto the ball for as long as possible.

Second Half:
00:00 Event: Kick-off by Swansea
00:00 Caption: 1 additional min. will be played.
00:01 Caption: The teams are back out for the second half and here is a change on the pitch. Louis van Gaal gives a chance to Antonio Valencia (Manchester United) and Paddy McNair is off.
00:01 Caption: Everything is set for the start of the second half.
00:29 Event: Substitution by Manchester
01:08 Event: Offside by Swansea
01:20 Caption: The game is interrupted as Bafetimbi Gomis (Swansea) is flagged offside.
02:25 Caption: Phil Jones (Manchester United) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Neil Swarbrick didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.

04:47 Caption: Angel Di Maria (Manchester United) sends in the corner, but the keeper steps in and makes a save.
04:48 Event: Corner by Manchester

09:00 Caption: Angel Di Maria (Manchester United) steps up to take the corner. He launches the ball into the penalty area, but it only finds the head of an opposing player who clears the danger. The ball is out of play. Manchester Utd will have a chance to score from a corner.
09:22 Caption: Wayne Rooney (Manchester United) takes the corner kick but the ball only finds the head of an opponent.

20:48 Event: Ball out of play

21:17 Event: Corner by Manchester
21:21 Caption: Lukasz Fabianski leaps to collect the ball from the corner which was sent over by Angel Di Maria (Manchester United).

22:26 Caption: Robin van Persie (Manchester United) takes a great touch after receiving a pass inside the box. He immediately unleashes a low shot to the middle of the goal, but the keeper pulls off a decent save!

25:24 Caption: Angel Di Maria (Manchester United) puts a dangerous cross into the box, but the corner is cleared by the first man.
27:07 Event: Goal by Swansea
27:39 Caption: Bafetimbi Gomis (Swansea) deflects his teammate's shot into the middle of the goal by using his body. The goalkeeper reacted to the earlier shot so the deflection only confused him. A lucky goal that counts anyway.
28:36 Event: Substitution by Swansea
28:38 Caption: The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Jefferson Montero (Swansea) comes onto the pitch so that Gylfi Sigurdsson can be given a rest.

37:38 Caption: The corner from Wayne Rooney (Manchester United) is hurriedly cleared.
37:39 Event: Corner by Manchester

40:34 Caption: Bafetimbi Gomis (Swansea) receives a precise low pass inside the box, controls the ball and drills it to the middle of the goal, but David de Gea makes a comfortable save to stop his effort.
41:06 Event: Ball out of play
41:24 Event: Throw-in by Swansea
41:53 Event: Foul by Swansea

42:30 Event: Direct free-kick by Manchester

49:53 Caption: Neil Swarbrick is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
49:59 Caption: There was no time for the supporters to get bored during the game as it was full of action and thrilling moments. It was an even match on the whole, with both sides enjoying spells in the ascendancy. The home team played long-ball football unlike the away side who attempted to hold onto the ball for as long as possible.
    

    #######TASK 
    Provide a factually correct and detailed textual description of the game compiled from the information presented above from different sources, in more than 1000 words.
            "Cap:": represents the captions published in the online portal usually within 30 seconds of the event.
            "E:" represents events recorded exactly after the event happened.
    Don't mention sources of information like commentators or captions, write as if you saw them live.
summary:
The clash between Swansea City and Manchester United at the Liberty Stadium was an enthralling encounter that displayed precision, agility, and tactical prowess. Set with relentless energy from the get-go, the match opened with Manchester United taking initial control.

From the first whistle, Manchester applied pressure, initiating their attack from the center. However, the physical aspect of the game was evident early, as only within the opening minute, Manchester committed a foul, setting an early aggressive tone. Swansea, undeterred, sought to find their rhythm through quick passes, but a subsequent series of throw-ins and fouls hindered the fluidity of play.

Barely settling in, Swansea earned a corner in the fourth minute, which led to a shot on target, revealing their intent. The Manchester defense withstood the early pressure, and the subsequent play resulted in a dead ball, easing the temporary siege. Both sides engaged in a back-and-forth struggle, with regular throw-ins disrupting any sustained possession.

Manchester's offense was spearheaded by Wayne Rooney, who, even under tight marking, managed a shot on target by the 19th minute, demonstrating his skilled control despite defensive pressure. Swansea's Jonjo Shelvey was a live wire, dynamically moving the ball forward, but an alert Manchester defense kept him at bay.

In a notable moment, Robin van Persie swung a dangerous ball into the penalty area around the 25th minute, though Lukasz Fabianski was deftly off his line to collect it. Van Persie's persistence paid off soon after, when a well-timed assist from Angel Di Maria found Ander Herrera, who skillfully converted the opportunity with a low shot that nestled into the bottom left corner to make it 1-0 to Manchester United in the 27th minute.

The match barely had time to breathe when Swansea delivered an almost immediate response. A slick build-up play culminated in Jonjo Shelvey's precise pass, finding Sung-Yong Ki, who deftly finished, leveling the score at 1-1 by the 29th minute. The Swansea supporters erupted, their joy evident as they relished the quick equalizer.

Tensions flared as fouls accumulated, and by the 44th minute, Marouane Fellaini found himself in the referee's book, receiving a yellow card for a reckless challenge. The first half concluded with an air of intensity, both sides evenly matched, intertwining moments of skill and hard-fought midfield battles.

The halftime break proved to be a tactical reset for both teams. Swansea kicked off the second half with renewed vigor. Manchester United made a strategic substitution, bringing on Antonio Valencia in place of Paddy McNair, aiming to add fresh legs to their attacking front.

Swansea's forward Bafetimbi Gomis tried to penetrate Manchester's defense early on but was caught offside. United’s physical approach continued as Phil Jones was quickly booked for a late tackle, adding to the mounting yellow cards against Manchester.

The ebb and flow of the match saw Manchester applying relentless pressure, earning multiple corners yet failing to breach Swansea’s resolute defense. The very capable Lukasz Fabianski was unwavering, consistently thwarting United’s efforts from set-pieces.

By the 62nd minute, Manchester made another tactical adjustment, sending Ashley Young into the fray for Luke Shaw, clearly aiming to inject pace on the wings. Robin van Persie continued to be a thorn in Swansea’s side, his close-range efforts forcing crucial saves and blocks.

In a significant turning point, Swansea capitalized on their opportunity in the 72nd minute. Gomis found himself fortunate as he redirected a teammate’s powerful strike into the goal. The initial shot had already caught David de Gea off-guard, making Gomis' intervention crucial but somewhat fortunate. Swansea fans roared as their team took the lead at 2-1.

Realizing the urgency, Manchester intensified their attempts. Continuous corner kicks by Wayne Rooney and Angel Di Maria, accompanied by powerful yet off-target strikes, typified their desperate search for an equalizer. Gomis continued to be influential, nearly doubling his tally but foiled once again by the ever-vigilant de Gea.

Swansea’s defense, led by Ashley Williams, remained sturdy. Williams, despite being booked for a foul, marshaled his defense with great composure, especially as Manchester threw everything forward in the dying embers of the match. The tension was palpable, as both sets of fans watched with bated breath.

Manchester committed yet another foul near the end, and Marcos Rojo received a yellow card in the 87th minute, signaling the rigorous physical battle on the pitch. In response, Swansea brought on Jordi Amat for Jonjo Shelvey, a clear move to solidify their defensive stance.

The game’s closing moments did not lack drama, as Swansea's time-wasting tactics and resilient defending added to Manchester's mounting frustrations. Despite multiple attempts towards the end, a resolute Swansea side held their ground strongly.

The final whistle brought an end to a highly charged and competitive match. Swansea emerged victorious with a 2-1 win over Manchester United, a result that highlighted their resilience, cohesiveness, and tactical acumen. The match was a testament to the heart and dedication shown by both teams, packed with noteworthy individual performances and strategic nuances that kept fans on the edge throughout.

While Manchester United demonstrated moments of brilliance and a relentless attacking front, it was Swansea's tactical discipline, timely counterattacks, and unyielding defense that secured them a hard-earned victory. The post-match reflections emphasized the battle of long-ball strategy vested by Swansea against the controlled possession game that Manchester United sought to impose, making for a captivating contest.

In summary, this clash was an exemplary display of football, rich in action, strategic depth, and the ever-present thrill that accompanies such high-stakes Premier League encounters. Swansea City's ability to convert critical moments into goals and their resolute defensive prowess ultimately granted them a memorable win against a formidable Manchester United side.
